abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Morazan Dam EmergencyProject in
            Honduras. The project had three basic objectives: i)
            maintaining the structural integrity of the Morazan Dam; ii)
            increasing the reliability of the power plants auxiliary
            system, and thereby minimizing the risk of interruption of
            the principal source of the country’s electricity supply,
            and iii) strengthening Empresa Nacional de Energia
            Electrica's (ENEE) emergency preparedness planning and
            its capacity to monitor the dam performance. The project
            objectives were successfully achieved. Bank performance was
            satisfactory. ENEE performance was satisfactory. The
            following reflect the lessons learned: The first lesson is
            that a borrower project team composed of qualified and
            motivated staff, is a key factor for the successful
            implementation of a project. A second lesson is that
            flexibility of all parties and development of mutual trust
            and respect among all factors involved in the project are
            essential for successful implementation. A third lesson is
            the confirmation of the importance of a panel of qualified
            experts (the Panel for the Security of the Dam) for
            providing guidance and advice in the implementation of
            difficult projects. The last lesson is that in projects with
            large dams and/or underground works under difficult
            geological conditions, there can be no final design until
            the project is completed. The project designs should be kept
            flexible enough to allow new and innovative technologies to
            be applied.
